name: 'Full Disclosure' Multiple Choice Quiz | 'West Wing' - Season 5 | 10 Questions

questions.text: Who told CJ about the tell-all article about Hoynes?
questions.explanation:
Taylor.

	While CJ was on Taylor Reid's show, he mentioned the article about former Vice President Hoynes. CJ had to hang up on Toby before he had a chance to tell her about the article Will found on Matt Drudge's internet website.

questions.text: When President Bartlet asked Charlie where he wanted to go to school, what school did Charlie say?
questions.explanation:
Parochial school.

	The President was talking to the mayor about school vouchers. He called Charlie in to ask him about schools. Charlie told the President he went to Roosevelt public school, but told the Mayor he wanted to go to Parochial school because they didn't have any shootings or metal detectors.

questions.text: How much of a monetary advance did former Vice President Hoynes get for his book?
questions.explanation:
$5 million.

	Greg Brock told CJ that the Vice President had already gotten a five-million dollar advance for his book. Hoynes told CJ he was going to title the book "Full Disclosure".

questions.text: How many pages of former Vice President Hoynes' diplomatic mistakes did Carol give to CJ?
questions.explanation:
Twelve.

	Will came up with the idea to make a list of all the former Vice President's mistakes so they could make it known. Carol had a list of all the things he almost messed up, bills he did mess up, and a list of diplomatic mistakes. Toby mentioned to CJ that he offended seven South American heads of state in five days.

questions.text: In what did Josh say Ed and Larry were experts?
questions.explanation:
Chinese bras.

	Toby used Ed and Larry to help him come up with a way to keep American bras inside the United States and not inside China's Wal-Mart stores.

questions.text: Did CJ get an advanced copy of Greg Brock's article on former Vice President Hoynes?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	Greg dropped a disk (on purpose) that had the Hoynes article on it. For his good deed, CJ said she could get him a Presidential statement on the Hoynes article before anyone else got it, but couldn't get him an exclusive interview with the President.

questions.text: Did the President and Leo agree on what the former Vice President had to say about the meeting that took place after news of his affair came out?
questions.explanation:
No.

	CJ needed Leo and the President to tell her if what the former Vice President had said was correct about the night the three of them discussed the affair. They both agreed that the former Vice President had things in the article that weren't correct.

questions.text: Which room did Toby have to use for his meeting with the AFL-CIO group?
questions.explanation:
Basement.

	Josh was using the Roosevelt room for the Base Closing Commission, Vice President Russell was using the Mural room for a meeting with an environmental group, and CJ was using the Press room.

questions.text:
"When you run for President, the press is going to find some of those women. And if you try to attack them, if you get your opposition research team working on them, if you try to destroy them, if you try to say they're all bimbos and liars, then I'll be standing right there with them and I'll be ready to take anything you or your people throw at me, anything. So don't make me tell the truth about you because it will be the whole truth." 

Where was CJ when she said this to Hoynes?
questions.explanation:
In his office.

	CJ was letting former Vice President Hoynes know that she would ruin him if he went after her or any of the other women who slept with him.

questions.text: What night did CJ tell Toby she regrets more than any other night in her life?
questions.correct: The night she slept with Hoynes
options: The night of the first Bartlet debate
The night of the assassination attempt
The night her mother passed away
questions.explanation:
The night she slept with Hoynes.

	Toby was the only person to know that CJ slept with Hoynes ten years earlier. CJ was worried it would come out in the book the former Vice President was writing, but Hoynes assured her that it wouldn't.
